abstract_summ: Chest CTs of 121 symptomatic patients infected with coronavirus disease-19 (COVID-19) from four centers in China from January 18, 2020 to February 2, 2020 were reviewed for common CT findings in relationship to the time between symptom onset and the initial CT scan . The hallmarks of the infection on imaging were bilateral and peripheral ground-glass and consolidative pulmonary opacities .
